## Four Policy Pillars

<div class="feature-grid">

<div class="content-box" style="border-left-color: var(--red); min-height: 300px;">
<h3 style="color: var(--red);">1. Priority Areas</h3>
<h4>Focus on the 62 Complaint Gap Areas First</h4>

**Implementation:**
- Designate Complaint Gap areas as "priority maintenance zones"
- Establish 48-hour repair target (vs. current reactive approach)
- Allocate 30% of maintenance budget to these underserved areas

**Rationale:**
These communities are systematically underserved by the 311 system. They need proactive attention, not reactive response.

**Expected Impact:**
- Reduce lighting inequality by 40% within 2 years
- Restore trust in government services
- Improve safety in most vulnerable neighborhoods

</div>

<div class="content-box" style="border-left-color: var(--blue); min-height: 300px;">
<h3 style="color: var(--blue);">2. Satellite Monitoring</h3>
<h4>Use VIIRS Data to Supplement 311 System</h4>

**Implementation:**
- Monthly VIIRS downloads and analysis
- Automated flagging of darkening areas
- Integration with work order system

**Rationale:**
Don't rely solely on complaints. Satellite data reveals what the 311 system misses.

**Expected Impact:**
- Identify problems before residents complain
- Catch 65% more lighting issues
- Enable predictive maintenance scheduling

</div>

<div class="content-box" style="border-left-color: var(--green); min-height: 300px;">
<h3 style="color: var(--green);">3. Equity Dashboard</h3>
<h4>Build Public Monitoring Dashboard</h4>

**Implementation:**
- Web-based dashboard tracking:
  - Lighting equity across neighborhoods
  - 311 complaint rates vs. actual darkness
  - Repair response times by area
  - LED upgrade progress and equity

**Rationale:**
Transparency creates accountability. Public monitoring ensures equitable service delivery.

**Expected Impact:**
- Increase public trust through transparency
- Enable community advocacy with data
- Hold city accountable to equity metrics

</div>

<div class="content-box" style="border-left-color: var(--orange); min-height: 300px;">
<h3 style="color: var(--orange);">4. Predictive Maintenance</h3>
<h4>Deploy Resources to 582 Predicted Areas</h4>

**Implementation:**
- Use Random Forest predictions to guide inspection schedules
- Preventive maintenance in predicted darkening areas
- Quarterly model updates with new VIIRS data

**Rationale:**
Act before failure. 80% of Philadelphia already decliningâ€”intervene proactively.

**Expected Impact:**
- Reduce infrastructure failures by 50%
- Lower long-term maintenance costs
- Prevent safety incidents in high-risk areas

</div>

</div>

## Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Immediate Actions (Months 1-3)

<div class="content-box">

**Launch Priority Area Program**
- Identify and map 62 Complaint Gap areas
- Deploy rapid response teams
- Establish 48-hour repair target

**Set Up Data Infrastructure**
- Monthly VIIRS data downloads
- Integrate with existing work order system
- Train maintenance staff on new protocols

**Budget:** $500K initial investment
**Staff:** 2 FTE data analysts, 5 FTE maintenance technicians

</div>

---

### Phase 2: System Integration (Months 4-9)

<div class="content-box content-box-blue">

**Build Equity Dashboard**
- Design public-facing web interface
- Integrate VIIRS, 311, maintenance data
- Launch with community feedback sessions

**Implement Predictive Maintenance**
- Deploy Random Forest model in production
- Generate quarterly maintenance schedules
- Monitor intervention effectiveness

**Budget:** $800K development and deployment
**Staff:** 3 FTE developers, 1 FTE project manager

</div>

---

### Phase 3: Evaluation & Expansion (Months 10-24)

<div class="content-box content-box-green">

**Measure Impact**
- Compare pre/post lighting equity metrics
- Survey residents in Complaint Gap areas
- Assess safety outcomes (crime, accidents)

**Refine & Expand**
- Adjust priority criteria based on results
- Expand satellite monitoring to detect LED failures
- Share methodology with other cities

**Budget:** $300K evaluation and refinement
**Staff:** 2 FTE evaluators, community engagement team

</div>

## Success Metrics

### How We'll Measure Impact

<div class="content-box">

**Equity Metrics:**
- Gap area VIIRS brightness increase (target: +30%)
- 311 complaint rate convergence (target: Â±20% of city average)
- Income-lighting correlation reduction (target: -50%)

**Operational Metrics:**
- Repair response time in Gap areas (target: <48 hours)
- Preventive interventions in predicted areas (target: 582 sites/year)
- Infrastructure failure rate (target: -50%)

**Community Metrics:**
- Resident satisfaction in Gap areas (target: +40%)
- Perception of safety improvement (target: +35%)
- 311 system awareness and access (target: +50%)

## Policy Recommendations Summary

<div style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--bg-dark) 0%, var(--bg-medium) 100%); padding: 2rem; border-radius: 12px; border-left: 4px solid var(--gold); margin: 2rem 0;">

### The Urgent Case for Action

**Model predicts 582 areas will darken. 80% of Philadelphia already declining. Act before failure.**

Philadelphia's streetlights date to the 1970s. Our 2022-2024 data captures the **critical period before the $91M LED project**â€”documenting peak infrastructure decline.

**This research provides the roadmap to ensure the new LED system doesn't perpetuate old inequities.**

</div>

## Replicability

<div class="callout">
<div class="callout-title">A Model for Other Cities</div>

This methodology is **fully replicable** in other U.S. cities:

**Required Data (all publicly available):**
- VIIRS satellite imagery (NASA, free)
- 311 service requests (city open data)
- Crime incidents (police open data)
- Census demographics (ACS 5-year)

**Required Tools (all open-source):**
- Python (pandas, geopandas, scikit-learn)
- QGIS or ArcGIS
- R/Quarto for reporting

**Timeline:** 3-6 months from data collection to policy recommendations

**Cities ready to replicate:** Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, Detroit, Baltimore

</div>
